summary.p: 235 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: R. 10; Qurʾānic Text: Q 2:3-end; 22 lines per page; Dimensions: 110 x 145mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 28: "83 R. 10. Aynı. Esmer kâğıt. 145mm boy ve 110mm eninde 235 yaprak. Sahifede kûfi İle 85mm uzunl.[uğunda] 22 satır. Tahmine göre. V- VI. (XI- XII) asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Baştan 1 yapragı eksiktir. Sure başları, secde, hizip v. s. gülleri tezhiplidir. Miklepli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu mushaf Baḳara (2) suresinin 3. ayetinin الصلوة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون ibaresiyle başlıyor."

This can be translated as follows: "83 R. 10. Same. Brown paper. 235 leaves of 145 mm height and 110 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 22 lines measuring 85 mm. Probably copied during the 5th - 6th (11th -12th) century. Sūra beginnings, sajda, ḥizb, and sajda roses are illuminated. The first folio was added later. Cherry brown leather binding with flap (miklep). This codex begins with the words الصلوة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون of Q 2: 3 (Sūra al-Baqara).”
